Matched Tactical Machining upper and lower.  If you have never seen Tactical Machining's receivers, they have a finish that is smoother than most and blacker than most.  If you ever wanted your black gun to be black, Tactical Machining is the way to go. The carrier is 8620 and the bolt is 9310.  This is the first 9310 bolt I've ever used.  The carrier and bolt are Nitride black.  I did remove the RSM firing pin retaining pin and replace it with a Colt pin.  The gas tube is a WMD/Spike's Tactical and it is Nitromet black.  The barrel is a 16" Bergara BB0251 mid-length with a 1 in 8" twist also Nitride black.  The flash hider is a standard A2 and is mounted with a Primary Weapons muzzle alignment kit, not a crush washer!   The barrel is marked .223 Rem though it is actually cut with a .223 Wylde chamber so it can safely handle higher pressure mil-spec 5.56 ammunition while giving better accuracy than most 5.56 barrels.  You can see the barrel here:  

http://www.bergarausa.com/Store-View.php?id=871

The grip is a Hogue and the selector has been properly relieved to clear the grip without dragging.  The forend is Magpul, as is the rear quick detach swivel.  The QD in the rear allows the two halves to still be separated for cleaning with the sling still in place.  The buttstock is a Fab defense GL-MAG on a Bushmaster receiver extension and it comes with a 10 round magazine.  The rear flip sight is a GG&G A2 style (GGG-1005).  The front sight is an A.R.M.S. (BL-41) which folds up into the traditional triangle shape has the mil-spec front sling swivel properly installed.  You can not buy those with the swivel preinstalled.  It has to be done after mounting.  The sights give a 1/3 lower cowitness through the red dot.  The red dot is a C-MORE Railway with a 4 M.O.A. dot.  Being a C-MORE, you can easily swap out the dot for a different size any time you wish.  With these iron sights it gives a sight picture the same as a C-MORE ATAC, but with the added advantage of having both sights fold completely out of the way!  The furniture and red dot are all olive drab.  

Finally, this gun comes with a generic 1.25" nylon sling (like the one DPMS sells) as well as a Bulldog lockable floating case and 4 Lancer Systems L5-AWM 30 round magazines, 3 of which are unopened.  The case and magazines are also olive drab.

You can look them up yourself, assuming you can even find the parts in green.  Magpul is discontinuing the OD parts, so good luck with that!  That's $650 in upgrades to your "$600 AR" and that's not even including that it comes with a sling, case, and 5 magazines!  The 4 Lancer magazines are worth $60 alone!  I know every component in this rifle and I know what it cost to build and what it is worth.  There is no Amazon or eBay junk on this gun and no Chinese copycat parts!
